entry.title: Revert "[ios] Avoid unnecessary copies when using TabsCloser"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 107192cd2a5aa869fda7872a88af58cfed859a91.



Reason for revert: Causes crashes if a SaveSession happens while

a "close all tabs" operation is in progress and undo-able.



Original change's description:

> [ios] Avoid unnecessary copies when using TabsCloser

>

> Add a notion of "backup Browser" to SessionRestorationService. This

> corresponds to a Browser where WebState can be moved without needing

> to copy the data.

>

> This is useful to implements TabsCloser when using the optimised

> session storage as there is no need to copy the state of unrealized

> WebState when moved to the backup Browser.

>

> This avoid doubling the storage needed to implement TabsCloser with

> the optimised session storage, reduce the amount of IO request and

> thus will allow explicitly saving the session after closing all the

> tabs (and after undoing the operation too).

>

> Bug: 1510953, 1383087

> Change-Id: Iba378221fbeb98408614037cb0696bec57ad06bb

entry.title: Reland "[ios] Track duration of the password save/update infobar"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit f82042dd87f27e5ecf7f4a26f089ac862196918d



With a minor fix that only concerned the unittest (client code was

fine).



Original change's description:

> [ios] Track duration of the password save/update infobar

>

> This CL adds the PasswordManager.iOS.InfoBar.{Type}Duration.{Moment}

> metric which is summarized as follow:

> """

> Records the duration of the password save/update infobar that is

> presented after using new credentials. Recorded when the

> password infobar banner is dismissed.

>

> Token key "Type":

> - variant "Save": the save infobar

> - variant "Update": the update infobar

>

> Token key "Moment":

> - variant "All": all moments

> - variant "OnDeletion": when deleting the infobar

> - variant "OnDismiss: when dismissing the infobar

> """

>

> This CL has also other effects:

> * Record metrics as soon as the infobar is dismissed instead of

> waiting until deletion. This should be no op as the infobar can

> only be presented once during the lifetime of the delegate, hence

> there shouldn't be a difference in the metrics when recording right

> after dismissal VS on delegate deletion. This has the advantage of

> speeding up the recording of infobar metrics on dismiss.

>

> Change-Id: If056bd6b5d28e1cc88b0809019ff5d3e1560dba7

> Bug: b/318687052, b/317337446, 1394793

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5172194

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

entry.title: Switch I420 GpuMemoryBuffer video to multi-planar
entry.content:
Currently I420 video frames from GpuMemoryBufferVideoFramePool use three

R_8 GpuMemoryBuffers and 3 corresponding shared images, aka one per

plane. The I420 path is only used when the video bit_depth > 8 but

no formats that support higher bit depths are available so the video

needs to be converted down to 8 bits using libyuv.



We don't have BufferFormat that matches I420, aka three separate YUV

channels, but we do have YVU_420 which has UV channel order swapped.

Switch to using YV12 as the output format in this case.



Note we can't easily use NV12 here since there is no libyuv intrinsics

for efficiently doing bit depth conversion and UV interleaving at the

same time. This could potentially be done as a follow up.



Using YV12 is only done when UseMultiPlaneFormatForSoftwareVideo is

enabled. There is also a kill switch feature UseYV12MultiPlanar to guard

against potential problems this introduces.



Bug: 1487288

Change-Id: I8f359114e9b552bc11dcc2484caac9fab3ebd53f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5179487

Reviewed-by: Johannes Kron

Reviewed-by: Saifuddin Hitawala

Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

Commit-Queue: Kyle Charbonneau

Reviewed-by: Vasiliy Telezhnikov

entry.title: [autofill - hats] BAM triggers on going user perception survey.
entry.content:
What this CL does?



1. Creates a method to generate the field filling stats from an

address form (maybe form structure is a better place?).

We are adding this information to the survey so that

we can correlate our filling correctness with the user's perception.

Hopefully we will be able to answer when improving filling correctness

leads to diminishing returns.

2. The generation of these stats requires the field types to be

determined. Therefore, it introduces a private method to BAM that will

not only call UploadVotesAndLogQuality but also trigger the survey.

3. Updates the triggering delay to 5 seconds (as per design doc

comments [1]).



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nyYO-JxAXkFNGi-Fyc6LvnvGNLTJ58GD53k9Niv8Zyw

Demo: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTk3Mzg0MTA0MDkwMDA5Nnw1NmFlMjU0Mi00Mw

entry.title: [ios] Avoid unnecessary copies when using TabsCloser
entry.content:
Add a notion of "backup Browser" to SessionRestorationService. This

corresponds to a Browser where WebState can be moved without needing

to copy the data.



This is useful to implements TabsCloser when using the optimised

session storage as there is no need to copy the state of unrealized

WebState when moved to the backup Browser.



This avoid doubling the storage needed to implement TabsCloser with

the optimised session storage, reduce the amount of IO request and

thus will allow explicitly saving the session after closing all the

tabs (and after undoing the operation too).



Bug: 1510953, 1383087

Change-Id: Iba378221fbeb98408614037cb0696bec57ad06bb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5198887

entry.title: Use GraphicsContext from TextPainterBase not PaintInfo arguments
entry.content:
A GraphicsContext object is bound to TextPainterBase - in all cases that

object is the same as PaintInfo::context. Use the former rather than the

latter. If this renders the PaintInfo argument unused then remove it.

entry.title: Fix end state messages in "MergeSession" test extension API
entry.content:
MergeSession test extension API has a couple of issues -



1. It doesn't send a `google-xhr-received` message, equivalent to the

`non-google-xhr-received` it sends for non-Google web properties.

2. It doesn't set the `nonGoogleRequestSent` variable correctly, the way

it sets the `googleRequestSent` variable while sending requests for

Google web properties.



Fix both of these issues.

entry.title: Reland "Make legacy colors store [0,255] internally"
entry.content:
This is a reland of

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5184777,

with additional rebaseline pngs for the unprefixed-radial-gradients

baselines.



Reason for revert: Had to rebaseline some image tests that are not run

on CQ and fail for individual pixel differences AND cannot be made

fuzzy 🙄



Original change's description:

> Revert "Make legacy colors store [0,255] internally"

>

> This reverts commit b98dc5706a670bb7b2ba8b25a6e0e787e58d5aec.

>

> Reason for revert:

> LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5766743815356416

>

> Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8758728881458395009

> Affected test(s):

> [ninja://:blink_web_tests/fast/gradients/unprefixed-radial-gradients-color-hints.html](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2F:blink_web_tests%2Ffast%2Fgradients%2Funprefixed-radial-gradients-color-hints.html?q=VHash%3A1da32bc6d12138b3)

>

> If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5766743815356416&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5184777&type=BUG

>

> Original change's description:

> > Make legacy colors store [0,255] internally

> >

> > See discussion here: https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9759

> > This CL fixes WPTs that are being were added here:

> > https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/43931/files

> >

> > We were previously normalizing legacy srgb colors so that they could

> > be treated interchangeably with non-legacy srgb colors. Unfortunately

> > this breaks math for relative colors, for example:

> >

> > rgb(from red calc(r - 127) g b)

> >

> > Should result in a half red, not black.

> >

> > The clearest way to fix this is simply to store legacy srgb colors in

> > the [0,255] range, so that we're not faking it on serialization

> > either. This of course makes conversions more complex as we have to

> > tread SRGBLegacy and SRGB as different color spaces, though they are

> > converted between one another by a simple multiplication or division

> > by 255.

> >

> > Also in this CL:

> > - Renamed ClampInt to ClampInt255, since that's what it does.

> > - Added a SerializeInternal() function to blink::Color that both CSS,

> > Legacy and Canvas serializers all use. It's useful for debugging since

> > it does not do things like converting hsl/hwb to srgb.

> > - Removed color-valid-relative-color.html from failure expectations,

> > so now we have an expectations file.

> >

> > The six new failures in color-computed-relative-color are due to bad

> > tests that assume this mapping specifically does not happen.

> >

> > Of the 42 failures in color-valid-relative-color, 36 are old and were

> > being suppressed by testExpectations. The 6 new ones are the same as

> > for the computed file.

> >

> > Bug: 1517349

> > Change-Id: I5e4bb8a4d469e0d018ce5022accdb6bc22b4c4dc

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5184777

> > Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> > Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

> > Commit-Queue: Aaron Krajeski

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1247537}

> >

>

entry.title: [iOS] Add OPEN, GET THE APP buttons in DL manager for Save to Drive
entry.content:
This CL updates the Download manager UI code with the following:

- OPEN and GET THE APP buttons are added which can be used respectively

to open a file saved to Drive in the Drive app (assuming it is

installed) and present StoreKit to install the Drive app (assuming it

is not installed).

- The local copy of a file which was saved to Drive is now deleted upon

successful completion of the associated upload task.

entry.title: Build and run more Quiche tests in net_unittests
entry.content:
Since test files are manually added to the BUILD.gn file for

Quiche, it's possible that unit tests that would be helpful to

run as part of net_unittests are missed. Assuming it's helpful

to build and run all the unit tests that correspond to source

files that we actually build, I went through these and have

manually added most of them.



The following I think meet the criteria above and we should

add eventually, but either require code/test changes to get

building or have at least one test that fails when run:

- src/quiche/common/btree_scheduler_test.cc

- src/quiche/common/print_elements_test.cc

- src/quiche/common/wire_serialization_test.cc

- src/quiche/http2/test_tools/hpack_example_test.cc

- src/quiche/quic/core/deterministic_connection_id_generator_test.cc

- src/quiche/quic/core/tls_server_handshaker_test.cc

- src/quiche/quic/core/quic_generic_session_test.cc

- src/quiche/quic/tools/connect_tunnel_test.cc

- src/quiche/quic/tools/connect_udp_tunnel_test.cc



To find the paths of tests that we don't build I used:

find net/third_party/quiche/src/ -name "*test.cc" | awk -F '/' '{print $NF}' | xargs -I{} bash -c "grep --silent -L {} net/third_party/quiche/BUILD.gn || echo {}" | xargs -I{} find net/third_party/quiche/src/quiche/ -name "{}"



Bug: 1517338

Change-Id: If04d1570d7149a7c9ac645facc65b849ce985e6d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5182578

Reviewed-by: Victor Vasiliev

Commit-Queue: Andrew Williams

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248105}

entry.title: Kcer: Split GetKeyInfo
entry.content:
The original idea was to retrieve all the attributes at once

because that can be done efficiently with the PKCS#11 interface.

Unfortunately in cases when the size of attributes is not known and

they can be missing, this doesn’t actually work well. E.g. if one

attribute was never set and the provided buffer for another one is

too small, the PKCS#11 interface can just return that some attributes

are missing and then the caller has to retry with a different set

of attributes to check that the “buffer is too small” error was

not hidden by the “attribute is missing” one.

So for custom attributes that are often never set it’s easier to

retrieve them separately.



Introduce GetKeyPermissions and GetCertProvisioningProfileId and

refactor the existing code to implement them.



Bug: b:287015636

Test: *Kcer* unit tests

Change-Id: I90f45890c49c75843fadcc487867f759db426818

entry.title: [A11y] De-flake AccessibilityCSSAltText
entry.content:
TL;DR: Don't process tree updates right after a whitespace-only node

is connected; rather, wait for (at most) three more nodes to connect,

or a text node with content, whichever comes first. This should give

us enough context to make a decision on inclusion of the whitespace

node.



Details:



AXObjectCacheImpl::NodeIsConnected un-pauses tree updates that were

paused due to whitespace-only nodes treating any new content as meaning

we had enough context around the whitespace to process updates. While

this is generally true, it can be false. Something seen more often in

the case of YieldingParser tests and tests run on *San bots.



If we were paused for an empty/whitespace text node, we are not ready

to make any decisions about that node's inclusion until we have some

text or a block node, i.e. more nodes need to be connected first.

That can be delayed, especially in YieldingParser tests and tests run on

*San bots. In addition, we won't know the layout of a node, or the

contents of a pseudo element at connection time, and attachment can be

delayed, especially in YieldingParser tests and tests run on *San bots.



To eliminate test flakiness of this nature, while keeping the code

simple, create a counter which we set to the maximum number of allowed

tree update pauses each time an empty/whitespace node is connected,

clear when we have text content, and decrement when the newly-

connected node is an element node. When this counter reaches 0, it

indicates we are ready to resume processing tree updates. This change

fixes the flakes in AccessibilityCSSAltText as well as most of those in

AccessibilityContenteditableDocsLi. Fixing the remaining flake in

AccessibilityContenteditableDocsLi will be done in a follow-up change.



Bugs: 1428967

Change-Id: I3318ecf7125802169be4a062c45bf904bb407073

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5145008

Commit-Queue: Joanmarie Diggs

Reviewed-by: Aaron Leventhal

Reviewed-by: Chris Harrelson

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248081}

entry.title: Deflake WPT `report-same-origin-with-cookies.html`
entry.content:
## Context



A flakiness of this test was reported [1] when the

KeepAliveInBrowserMigration was enabled in fieldtrial testing

config. It appears that the same-origin CSP request (which is also

a fetch keepalive request) made by the browser contains no expected

cookie.



However, this behavior is not specific to the enabled migration. It

can be unreliably repro-d by slowing down the browser handling of

the CSP report-uri request (e.g. happens after I added many STDERR

logging statements to the KeepAliveURLLoader related codes).



## Root Cause



The JS statement to clear the cookie, i.e.



```

test.add_cleanup(() => {

// May be executed before report-uri request, which can outlive the

// document!

document.cookie = "cspViolationReportCookie2=; path=/; expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:01 GMT";

});

```



that intended to be executed after test finished, sometimes get

executed "before" the browser sending out the CSP report-uri request,

leading to a no-cookie report request.



## The Fix



This CL removes the clearing of cookie `cspViolationReportCookie2`

to prevent from any potential flakiness.



Note that it should not affect any other tests (nor this test), as

this cookie is only used by this WPT.



Also, this WPT actually sets two cookies,

`cspViolationReportCookie2` (via python server) and

`report-same-origin-with-cookies` (via .headers file). But the latter

one is never cleared.



## Tested



This CL is tested via the same way mentioned in [2].



[1]: https://crbug.com/1509997#c5

[2]: https://crbug.com/1509997#c12



Bug: 1356128,1509997

Change-Id: If3559728670f88cb7fce2504a9ed13fbe76937a3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5203976

Reviewed-by: Antonio Sartori

Commit-Queue: Ming-Ying Chung

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248079}

entry.title: [Autofill] Rationalize contenteditables to UNKNOWN_TYPE
entry.content:
This CL adds rationalization that overrides the types of

contenteditables with UNKNOWN_TYPE. This disables suggestions and

filling of contenteditables.



Contenteditables can still impact parsing and crowdsourcing, but

only under rather obscure circumstances: a contenteditable can end

up in an autofillable form only if it lives in an iframe and the

user interacted with it, so that the contenteditable is flattened

into some ancestor frame's form.



Additionally, this CL excludes contenteditables from autocomplete.



Bug: 1490372, 1484810

Original change's description:

> Prerender: Do not invoke show/hide/unload events on prerender cancellation

entry.title: [bookmarks] Add separate UUID index for account bookmarks
entry.content:
Behavioral changes behind feature toggle

syncer::kEnableBookmarkFoldersForAccountStorage, disabled by default.



This patch introduces NodeTypeForUuidLookup::kAccountNodes to maintain

an independent UUID index for account bookmarks, which is motivated by

the fact that UUID collisions are allowed in certain cases (in

particular if a bookmark is duplicated across local storage and account

storage).



Having this independent index allows cleaning up some technical debt in

the form of removed TODOs:

1) Permanent folders now adopt their real UUID, without workarounds for

account nodes.

2) BookmarkModelView::HasWellKnownPermanentNodeUuids() can be removed as

it always evaluates to true, re-enabling certain DCHECKs that were

previously disabled as workaround.



Moves across storage/partition boundaries remain unimplemented, subject

to follow-up patches tacking them.



Change-Id: Ie4a488d9d14700e611854cc534852faf2992fe8d

Bug: 1494120

entry.title: [SWAutoPreload] Introduce base::span for the buffer management
entry.content:
This is a refactoring CL to avoid out-of-bounds errors while accessing

to the buffer in SWRaceNetworkRequest.



Before this CL, both read and write buffers are managed with void

pointers, which are used as arguments of mojo APIs to read/write data

pipes. Basically those buffers should have appropriate memory space

allocated by mojo APIs, but as SWAutoPreload calls mojo data pipe's

two-phase I/O operations for both read and write process involving buffer size changes, so technically it's possible that the memcpy() causes out-of-bounds.



This CL introduces base::span container to manage both read and write

buffers, which guarantees the safe access to memory. Also adds some

CHECKs before performing the memcpy operation to check if buffers have

enough space.



Bug: 1502946, 1472634

Change-Id: I0516db8b7a5688dd0a40395b209a491f280a811a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5199358

entry.title: Move code out of PDMCleaner::CleanupDataAndNotifyPersonalDataObservers()
entry.content:
On startup, the PDM loads all data from the database, which is done by

sending multiple queries to the database (one for local-or-syncable

profiles, account profiles, local cards, server cards, etc). After every

query that finishes, PDM observers are notified that something has

changed.



The exception is the last query that finishes (the one concluding the

initial loading of personal data). In this case, we instead perform

deduplication - and only after has finished, notify observers and log

stored data metrics (how many profiles the user has stored, etc).

Since deduplication might happen async, since the alternative state

name map needs to be populated, this can delay the notification.



This CL changes this to:

- Immediately notifying observers, even if deduplication hasn't

finished yet. This makes sense, since the PDM's state has changed

regardless, because the loading of some data has finished.

If deduplication removes some profiles, this will cause additional

notifications later anyways.

- Immediately logging stored data metrics. This actually doesn't change

the semantics of the metrics - since database modifications are

async and only show up in the PDM afterwards, the current stored

data metrics are already oblivious to changes made by deduplication.



Effectively, this is just moving code from PDMCleaner::

CleanupDataAndNotifyPersonalDataObservers() to PDM::

OnWebDataServiceRequestDone(). This is desirable, because it will

enable merging CleanupDataAndNotifyPersonalDataObservers() and

ApplyAddressAndCardFixesAndCleanups() in a follow-up CL, simplifying

some hard-to-read code that ultimately led to crbug.com/1517515.



Bug: 1007974, 1517515

Change-Id: I88cf7f3f5e719b45d2aef94ae189fa863da65836

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5189306

entry.title: All Sites: Read number of cookies from BDM
entry.content:
This CL introduces the logic of cookie information being extracted from the browsing data model behind the `kDeprecateCookiesTreeModel` feature.



In the site_settings_handler_unittest some restructuring

was introduced. Some of the tests in the `SiteSettingsHandlerTest` test suite were parameterised and others weren't. This introduced a weird behaviour when needing to expand the testing further with other parameters.This CL resolved this by:

- Splitting out the parameterised scheme tests into their own test suite.

- Added a new param for enabling and disabling the `kDeprecateCookiesTreeModel` feature.

- Introduced Cookie entries for the browsing data model to match the ones in the feature off state.

- Updated all affected tests with the appropriate checks based on the feature state.



There was a bug found due to order of origin insertion that will be fixed in a follow up; a bug has been filed here: crbug.com/1518460



Bug: 1271155, b:277057225

entry.title: Prerender: Do not invoke show/hide/unload events on prerender cancellation
entry.content:
As it's hard for prerendered pages to ensure triggering events on

cancellation, we decided not to trigger unload events on cancellation.

Also, show/hide should not be triggered while prerendering, but these

are unexpected dispatched before the unload events.



This CL adds explicit code to omit their handling to make the behavior

stable.



Bug: 1222551, 1289245

entry.title: Fix :has() invalidation error with nesting parent containing hover
entry.content:
Sets ContainsPseudoInsideHasPseudoClass flag of a :has() selector if its

argument contains nesting parent.



Currently, the CSSSelectorParser doesn't set the above flag if the :has()

selector's argument has a nesting parent selector and the nesting parent

contains a pseudo selector.



Due to this, even if the pseudo state in the nesting parent is changed,

StyleEngine skips :has() invalidation for the pseudo state change because

the :has() anchor element doesn't have AffectedByPseudoInHas flag set.



To fix this, CSSSelectorParser sets ContainsPseudoInsideHasPseudoClass

flag if the :has() selector contains a nesting parent selector in its

argument selector.



Bug: 1517866

Change-Id: I41b6f69a83db41a4e519490018bfb214a724f807

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5203146

Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

Commit-Queue: Byungwoo Lee

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248019}

entry.title: Avoid that AxTreeSourceViews members become dangling.
entry.content:
This CL fixes two dangling pointers:

1) AxTreeSourceViews::cache_, which became dangling during the call to

AutomationManagerAura::Disable, since the cache was destroyed just

prior to resetting the tree that kept a reference to the cache.

2) AxTreeSourceViews::root_: In this case the issue was the shutdown

order of Widget. root_ points to an AXWidgetObjWrapper that observes

the widget that (indirectly, in a chain starting with its RootView)

owns AxTreeSourceViews. AxWidgetObjWrapper observes the Widget and,

in OnWidgetDestroying, calls the cache that owns the

AxWidgetObjWrapper and requests its own deletion. Since the call to

OnWidgetDestroying happens prior to the call to delete the RootView,

AxTreeSourceViews' pointer to root_ becomes dangling.

This CL fixes that by storing the AxWidgetObjWrapper's unique ID

instead of a pointer to it and uses the ID to look up the object

in cache_ when needed.



Bug: 1469136

issues.

entry.title: ozone: dnd: decouple DataAvailable from Enter event
entry.content:
Until now, dnd code for each ozone platform must suppress platform

events until the advertised drag data is fully fetched from the drag

source/compositor. That very same functionality is mostly implemented at

views' DesktopDragDropClientOzone, except for a few missing bits.

Besides leading to duplicated logic at platform code, handing that at

that level over-complicates platform code with no real advantage. On

Wayland backend, for example, it has been a source of subtle bugs.



With this CL, basically the event suppressing responsibility is moved

all the way up to DesktopDragDropClientOzone, by decoupling original

WmDropHandler's OnDragDataFetched from OnDragEnter, as well as updating

their impls accordingly. At ozone platform level, both for x11 and

wayland, the call-sites are kept basically as is for now, so real

decoupling there will be done in follow-up CLs, where more cleanups and

code simplification should be made possible as well.



No behavioral change is expected, so no new tests added.



R=sky



Bug: 1487784

entry.title: [AsyncSB] Show subresource warnings based on is_subresource.
entry.content:
Currently, the subresource warning string is determined by

is_main_frame_load_blocked, which is not equivalent to is_subresource.

For example, if the threat type is

SB_THREAT_TYPE_URL_CLIENT_SIDE_PHISHING, even though the warning is

triggered by the mainframe URL, is_main_frame_load_blocked is false so

the subresource warning string is shown. This issue will be more

prevalent after we enable async check.



Also rename is_main_frame_load_blocked to

is_main_frame_load_pending so the name is consistent with the function

name IsMainPageLoadPending.

entry.title: Audio: Set correct channel layout for 4 channel audios
entry.content:
On macOS, Audio MIDI only support setup 4 channel layout as

Quadraphonic(kAudioChannelLayoutTag_Quadraphonic) which equals to

"CHANNEL_LAYOUT_2_2" in FFMPEG/Chrome. FFMPEG and Chrome will guess

4 channel layout as "CHANNEL_LAYOUT_QUAD" which will always result

in silent channel 3/4 output on Macs.



On Windows, the system also support setup 4 channel layout as

Quadraphonic(KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_QUAD) which equals to "CHANNEL_LAYOUT_QUAD"

in FFMPEG/Chrome, so there is not such issue on Windows.



Manual test steps:

1. Create a Aggregate Device with 4 channel count and Quadraphonic layout.

2. Before the fix, play "bear-opus-end-trimming-4ch-channelmapping2.webm"

has no channel 3/4 sound output.

3. Before the fix, using script in https://crbug.com/1515122#c16

has no channel 3/4 sound output.

4. After the fix, play the same file, has 3/4 channel sound output.

5. After the fix, using the same script, has 3/4 channel sound output.



Bug: 1515122

Change-Id: Ic86876788bec13bcf63d776ab3561645a9e8fdaf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5196930

entry.title: [PA] Support building allocator_shim.dll.
entry.content:
PS6 = baseline



Split allocator_shim.cc into the following files:

- allocator_shim.cc (linux, chromoes, fuchsia)

- allocator_shim_apple.cc (MacOSX, iOS)

- allocator_shim_android.cc (Android)

- allocator_shim_win_static.cc (Windows)

- allocator_shim_win_component.cc (Windows component build)



Because of DLL-import and DLL-export conflict, we cannot

implement malloc() in a source which includes malloc.h.

So allocator_shim_win_component.cc doesn't include malloc.h.

Instead it depends on allocator_shim_win.cc and the file

does atomic, checked math and so on, which causes including

malloc.h)



Bug: 1429450

entry.title: [Files F2] Fix console error when open Android app
entry.content:
chrome.fileManagerPrivate.selectAndroiPickerApp requires the

parameter type to be chrome.fileManagerPrivate.AndroidApp, but

the one we passed previously is the extended AndroidApp type which

has an additional "icon" field, so before passing it to the

private API, we need to remove the "icon" field, otherwise there

will be an console error.



Open Gmail (Andriod version) from ChromeOS and compose a new

email, then attach a file to open file picker, in the opened file

picker, click "Photos" item from the directory tree.

entry.title: Revert^2 "[Shortstand] Run WebAppIntegrationTest with Shortstand flag off."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 0b077528c3cf7ac40b43673fafb8364f5f6b17a0.



Reason for revert: I speculatively reverted the original CL. But

it seems my idea was wrong. The sync_integration_tests failure has

disappeared even before the reverting CL landed at r1247954.





Original change's description:

> Revert "[Shortstand] Run WebAppIntegrationTest with Shortstand flag off."

>

> This reverts commit 247acf8a4fc243d263f3dacd32b47a6e0e83cbcb.

>

> Reason for revert: speculatively reverting for crbug.com/1518797 and crbug.com/1518931

>

> Bug: 1518797, 1518931

>

> Original change's description:

> > [Shortstand] Run WebAppIntegrationTest with Shortstand flag off.

> >

> > This CL makes the WebAppIntegrationTest to always run with Shortstand

> > flag off even after it is enabled by default. This is because Shortstand

> > changes the behaviour of shortcuts, which would need significant changes

> > to WebAppIntegrationTest, and our long term goal is to remove the

> > shortcut support entirely from WebAppIntegrationTest. So instead of

> > update all the tests to support it, we will write separate integration

> > tests to cover the new cases and leave this flag off in the existing

> > tests.

> >

> > BUG=b/319545692

> >

> > Change-Id: I260dc2aaa79a109e63f376ae8ac77fd6f6df3733

entry.title: Move kDeprecateUnloadAllowlist parameter to a separate feature.
entry.content:
This adds a new parameter, `kDeprecateUnloadByAllowlist`, which controls whether the allow-list is used and the allow-list is attached to this parameter.



Having it on the mains kDeprecateUnload features means we have to provide the list in every finch group. This will cause a blow-up in finch data size.



We would enabled kDeprecateUnloadByAllowlist for 100% of users and pass the allow list once to all users.



Fixed: 1518694

Change-Id: I2ab982fb26a5b2626b79eec56bd99621dadbba6d

entry.title: [blink_apis] Sort `depends_on` list.
entry.content:
`blink_api_proto.py` serializes Blink API metadata using as a textproto.

Some repeated fields may wind up with non-deterministic ordering thereby

causing the resulting API list of to be unstable.



To address this, ideally we should enforce a deterministic ordering on all

repeated fields of the API metadata message. However in practice the

ordering is enforced implicitly for most of the fields other than

`IDLType.depends_on`.



Change-Id: Id2e350c9037dfc8ba238c119ad4133a17b4b79b0

Fixed: 1518420

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5201589

Reviewed-by: Paul Jensen

Commit-Queue: Asanka Herath

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1247964}

entry.title: Revert "[Shortstand] Run WebAppIntegrationTest with Shortstand flag off."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 247acf8a4fc243d263f3dacd32b47a6e0e83cbcb.



Reason for revert: speculatively reverting for crbug.com/1518797 and crbug.com/1518931



Bug: 1518797, 1518931



Original change's description:

> [Shortstand] Run WebAppIntegrationTest with Shortstand flag off.

>

> This CL makes the WebAppIntegrationTest to always run with Shortstand

> flag off even after it is enabled by default. This is because Shortstand

> changes the behaviour of shortcuts, which would need significant changes

> to WebAppIntegrationTest, and our long term goal is to remove the

> shortcut support entirely from WebAppIntegrationTest. So instead of

> update all the tests to support it, we will write separate integration

> tests to cover the new cases and leave this flag off in the existing

> tests.

>

> BUG=b/319545692

>

> Change-Id: I260dc2aaa79a109e63f376ae8ac77fd6f6df3733

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5191337

> Commit-Queue: Maggie Cai

> Reviewed-by: Glen Robertson

> Reviewed-by: Daniel Murphy

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1247032}

> Add //build/cros_cache/cipd/ to data of all CrOS simple chrome tests
